intro: Taenianthera minor, commonly known as the lesser taenianthera, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers. The plant has a short, upright stem with narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
